scheme.definition: Role of an alternative identifier.
scheme.name: Alternative Identifer Role

scheme.definition: Property of an artwork or object.
scheme.name: Artwork or Object Property

scheme.definition: Indicates how the metadata value was applied.
scheme.name: Application of Metadata Values

scheme.definition: A sport facet of a concept.
scheme.name: A Sport Facet

scheme.definition: A value which may be used with specific facet(s) of the Sport Facets NewsCodes - http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/asportfacet/
scheme.name: Value of a Sport Facet

scheme.definition: Indicates a name of an audio-encoder/decoder.
scheme.name: Audiocodec
scheme.note: Many of these encoders/decoders are controlled by international standards.

scheme.name: Authority Status
scheme.definition: Describes the status of the authority managing a resource such as a scheme or a catalog.
Indicates the nature of the content of a Catalog Item.
scheme.name: Nature of a Catalog Item
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 items.

scheme.definition: Defines the name and the semantics (not the value) of a physical characteristic of the content of a NewsML 1 news item.
scheme.name: Characteristics Property
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML 1.x items.

scheme.definition: Indicates the nature of the concept in a G2 Concept Item or Knowledge Item.
scheme.name: Nature of a G2 Concept Item
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 items.

scheme.definition: Indicates the colorspace of a digital image.
scheme.name: Colorspace

scheme.definition: Indicates the basic colouring of an image.
scheme.name: Colour Indicator

scheme.definition: Indicates the communication technology used for this part of the contact info.
scheme.name: Communication Technology

scheme.definition: Role of a definition of a concept.
scheme.name: Concept Definition Role

scheme.definition: Role of a note about a concept.
scheme.name: Concept Note Role

scheme.definition: The relationship between the current concept and the target concept.
scheme.name: Concept Relation

scheme.definition: Indicates the degree of certainty that an applied metadata value is correct.
scheme.name: Confidence
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML 1.x items.

scheme.definition: Indicates the role of a part of a contact info component.
scheme.name: Role of a Part of the Contact Info
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 items.

scheme.definition: Indicates why the content of the item should be reviewed as it may be perceived as being offensive.
scheme.name: Content Warning

scheme.definition: Indicates the role of a contributor
scheme.name: Contributor Role

scheme.definition: Indicates the basic nature of a concept.
scheme.name: Nature of a Concept
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 items.

scheme.definition: The role of a party (person or organisation) which created, originated, supplied, enhanced, distributed or contributed in another way to the content, or the role of a party which supported these activities.
scheme.name: Content Production Party Role

scheme.definition: Indicates the role that a specific instance of a description takes among all descriptions.
scheme.name: Description Role

scheme.definition: Indicates from which source a digital image was created.
scheme.name: Digital Source Type

scheme.definition: Indicates the unit used for measuring a dimension of content.
scheme.name: Dimension Unit

scheme.definition: Indicates the role of an editorial note
scheme.name: Editorial Note Role

scheme.definition: Indicates the role this item takes in an editorial workflow.
scheme.name: Editorial Role
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 items.

scheme.definition: Indicates an encoding scheme used to transform data.
scheme.name: Encoding
scheme.note: This vocabulary may be used with NewsML 1.x and NewsML-G2

scheme.definition: Property of an entity.
scheme.name: Entity Property

scheme.definition: Indicates the class of the contact information.
scheme.name: Event Contact Info Role

scheme.definition: Indicates whether start and/or end dates and, optionally, times are confirmed.
scheme.name: Event Date Confirmation

scheme.definition: Indicates how certain the occurrence of the event is.
scheme.name: Event Occurence Status

scheme.definition: Indicates the role an organiser takes in the event.
scheme.name: Event Organiser Role

scheme.definition: Indicates the role a participant takes in the event.
scheme.name: Event Participant Role

scheme.definition: Indicates the class of a registration.
scheme.name: Event Registration Role

scheme.definition: Indicates the type of the symbol identifying a financial instrument.
scheme.name: Financial Instrument Symbol Type

scheme.definition: Indicates the technical format of content.
scheme.name: Format

scheme.definition: Generic concepts which could be applied to virtually all properties
scheme.name: Generic Concepts

scheme.definition: Indicates a nature, journalistic or intellectual characteristic of an item.
scheme.name: Genre

scheme.definition: Indicates the scope of a hash value.
scheme.name: Hash Scope
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 items.

scheme.definition: Indicates the function by which a hash value was generated.
scheme.name: Hash Type
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 items.

scheme.definition: Indicates the action taken at a hop of the hop history.
scheme.name: Hop Action
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 items.

scheme.definition: Indicates the target to which an action taken at a hop of the hop history applies.
scheme.name: Hop Action Target
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 items.

scheme.definition: Indicates how a metadata value was extracted from the content.
scheme.name: How Extracted

scheme.definition: Indicates how a metadata property relates to the content of a NewsML 1 news item.
scheme.name: How Present
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML 1.x items.

scheme.definition: Terms required for organising IPTC's controlled vocabularies
scheme.name: IPTC Knowledge Organisation System
Image Region Role
scheme.definition: Role of an image region among other image regions of the same image or other images

scheme.name: Image Region Type
scheme.definition: Type of thing(s) depicted by a region in an image
Indicates the importance of an item of metadata applied to a news item.
scheme.name: Importance
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML 1.x items.

scheme.definition: Indicates the role of an information source.
scheme.name: Information Source Role

scheme.definition: Indicates the relationship between the current item and the target resource.
scheme.name: Item-Relation

scheme.definition: Indicates the way the target item is represented at this location.
scheme.name: Item Representation

scheme.definition: Indicates the type of a label.
scheme.name: Label Type
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML 1.x items.

scheme.definition: Indicates the role of the language among all languages used by the content.
scheme.name: Language Role

scheme.definition: Indicates whether the human interpretation of the top of the image is aligned to its short or long side.
scheme.name: Layout orientation

scheme.definition: Indicates the type of a location.
scheme.name: Location Type
scheme.note: This vocabulary may be used with NewsML 1.x and NewsML-G2.

scheme.definition: Indicates a subject of an item.
scheme.name: Media Topic
scheme.note: The Media Topic NewsCodes is IPTC's new (as of December 2010) 1100-term taxonomy with a focus on text. The development started with the Subject Codes and extended the tree to 5 levels and reused the same 17 top level terms. The terms below the top level have been revised and rearranged. Each Media Topic provides a mapping back to one of the Subject Codes.

scheme.definition: Indicates a basic media type of news content.
scheme.name: Media Type (G2)
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 items.

scheme.definition: Indicates a basic media type of news content.
scheme.name: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML 1.x items.
scheme.note: Media Type (NewsML 1)

scheme.definition: Indicates the part of a name.
scheme.name: Name Part

scheme.definition: Indicates the role this specific instance of a name takes among all names.
scheme.name: Name Role

scheme.definition: Indicates the intention of the news provider to cover an event.
scheme.name: News Coverage Status

scheme.definition: Indicates, in a very broad way, the type of ContentItem carried by a NewsML 1 news item.
scheme.name: News Item Type
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML 1.x items.

scheme.definition: Indicates how the items conveyed by a News Message should be processed.
scheme.name: News Message Signal
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 News Messages.

scheme.definition: Indicates a product of a News Provider.
scheme.name: News Product
scheme.note: See also the News Provider NewsCodes

scheme.definition: Indicates a News Provider registered with the IPTC.
scheme.name: News Provider
scheme.note: See also the News Product NewsCodes

scheme.definition: Indicates the nature of news in a News Item or Package Item.
scheme.name: Nature of a News Item
scheme.note: Relates to the media type of the news content. / This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 items.

scheme.definition: Indicates the notation of a ContentItem.
scheme.name: Notation
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML 1.x items.

scheme.definition: Indicates a target audience for an item.
scheme.name: Of Interest To

scheme.definition: Indicates whether the members of a Package Item group are complementary or alternative and whether their order is relevant.
scheme.name: Packagegroup Mode
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 items.

scheme.definition: Indicates the nature of the content of a Planning Item.
scheme.name: Nature of a Planning Item
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 items.

scheme.definition: Indicates the relative priority of an item for a distribution process.
scheme.name: Priority

scheme.definition: Product genres for media objects
scheme.name: Product Genre

scheme.definition: Indicates the type of a NewsML 1 Property element.
scheme.name: Property Type
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML 1.x items.

scheme.definition: Indicates a company, publication or service provider.
scheme.name: Provider (deprecated)
scheme.note: The successors of this vocabulary are the News Product and News Provider NewsCodes.

scheme.definition: Indicates the publishing status of a G2 item.
scheme.name: Publishing Status (G2)
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 items, NewsML 1 items use a different vocabulary.

scheme.definition: Indicates the type of the parties which have contributed to a rating.
scheme.name: Rater Type NewsCodes

scheme.definition: Indicates how the applied numeric rating value was calculated from a sample of values.
scheme.name: Rating Calculation Type NewsCodes

scheme.definition: Indicates the relevance of a NewsML 1 news item to the target audience specified by "OfInterestTo".
scheme.name: Relevance
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML 1.x items.

scheme.definition: Indicates a kind of content rendition.
scheme.name: Content Rendition
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 items.

scheme.definition: Indicates the aspect of intellectual property rights that are expressed by a rights info property in a G2 item.
scheme.name: Rights Info Aspect
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 items.

scheme.definition: Property regarding rights.
scheme.name: Rights Property

scheme.definition: Indicates the scope of a rights info property in a G2 item.
scheme.name: Rights Info Scope
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 items.

scheme.definition: Indicates the role of a NewsML 1 news item within a package of several news items.
scheme.name: Role in Package
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML 1.x items.

scheme.definition: Indicates the units of a numeric rating value
scheme.name: Rating Scale Unit NewsCodes

scheme.definition: Indicates a type of scene covered by an item.
scheme.name: Scene

scheme.definition: Indicates how severe the impact from the signal is.
scheme.name: Severity
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to G2 items.

scheme.definition: The signals are instructions to the processor of an item that the content may require special handling.
scheme.name: Signal
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 items.

scheme.definition: Indicates the current usability of a NewsML 1 news item.
scheme.name: Status (NewsML 1)
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML 1.x items.

scheme.definition: Indicates a subject of an item.
scheme.name: Subject Code
scheme.note: The Subject Codes is IPTC's original subject taxonomy, with a focus on text. It consists of about 1400 terms organized into 3 levels. Note that Subject Code is now deprecated. IPTC recommends that users instead use the Media Topic vocabulary, which is regularly reviewed and updated.

scheme.definition: Indicates a narrower attribute-like context for a Subject Code, e.g. for sports: the gender of participants, indoor/outdoor competition etc.
scheme.name: Subject Qualifier
scheme.note: This vocabulary should be used with the Subject Codes

scheme.definition: Indicates the unit of time used for measuring the length of audio or video content.
scheme.name: Time Unit

scheme.definition: Indicates the type of a concept represented by a topic.
scheme.name: Topic Type
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML 1.x items.

scheme.name: Trust Indicator
scheme.definition: Indicators of how a journalism organisation works to encourage readers to consider them worthy of their trust
scheme.note: This vocabulary was created through IPTC's adoption of The Trust Project's Trust Indicators and collaboration with the Journalism Trust Initiative

scheme.definition: Indicates the editorial urgency of an item.
scheme.name: Urgency

scheme.definition: Indicates the type of user action.
scheme.name: User Action Type NewsCodes

scheme.definition: Indicates the format of a string value.
scheme.name: Value Format

scheme.definition: Indicates a name of a video-encoder/decoder.
scheme.name: Videocodec
scheme.note: Many of these encoders/decoders are controlled by international standards.

scheme.definition: Indicates the video definition by basic terms.
scheme.name: Video Definition

scheme.definition: Qualifier of a video metadata property.
scheme.name: Video Qualifier

scheme.definition: Indicates how video content is scaled.
scheme.name: Video Scaling

scheme.definition: Indicates why the metadata value has been included.
scheme.name: Why Present
scheme.note: This vocabulary applies only to NewsML-G2 items.

scheme.definition: Indicates a region of the world.
scheme.name: World Region

scheme.definition: The category code of the story may be any of the single alpha characters from the vocabulary. (ANPA 1312 specs, section J)
scheme.name: ANPA 1312 Category Codes
scheme.note: Body owning this CV: This vocabulary was previously owned by NAA

scheme.definition: The priority of a transmission is designated by any of the single alpha characters from the vocabulary. (ANPA 1312 specs, section H)
scheme.name: ANPA 1312 Priority Codes
scheme.note: Body owning this CV: This vocabulary was previously owned by NAA

scheme.definition: The wire designator code will be an upper- or lowercase single alpha character that identifies the basic nature of the service. (ANPA 1312 specs, section B)
scheme.name: ANPA 1312 Service Level Codes
scheme.note: Body owning this CV: This vocabulary was previously owned by NAA

scheme.definition: The information in this field is designed to enable newspaper systems to distinguish new leads, inserts, corrections and adds, so that the process of automatically assembling separately transmitted portions of a story is not limited to putting the latest material at the bottom of the file. (ANPA 1312 specs, section O)
scheme.name: ANPA 1312 Version Codes
scheme.note: Body owning this CV: This vocabulary was previously owned by NAA

scheme.definition: Language tags are used to help identify languages, whether spoken, written, signed, or otherwise signaled, for the purpose of communication.
scheme.name: BCP47 Language Tags
scheme.note: Body owning this CV: IETF - www.ietf.org

scheme.definition: The CUSIP is the National Securities Identification Number for products issued from both the United States and Canada.
scheme.name: Committee on Uniform Security Identification Procedures
scheme.note: Body owning this CV: Owned by the American Bankers Association, and operated by S&P Capital IQ.
Body owning the format of the codes: CUSIP Global Services (CGS) - www.cusip.com/

scheme.definition: The FIGI is a Financial Instrument Identification Framework designed to enable effective and scalable data management within organisations.
scheme.name: Financial Instrument Global Identifier
scheme.note: Body owning this CV: Owned by the Object Management Group (OMG), and operated by openFIGI - www.openfigi.com
Body owning the format of the codes: Object Management Group (OMG) - www.omg.org

scheme.definition: The GICS classifications aim to enhance the investment research and asset management process for financial professionals worldwide. It is the result of numerous discussions with asset owners, portfolio managers and investment analysts around the world and is designed to respond to the global financial community's need for an accurate, complete and standard industry definition.
scheme.name: GICS - Global Industry Categorisation Standard
scheme.note: Body owning this CV: GICS was developed by MSCI and Standard & Poor’s, and is maintained by MSCI.
Body owning the format of the codes: MSCI Products - GICS: https://www.msci.com/our-solutions/indexes/gics

scheme.definition: Security numbers based on the ISO 6166 standard.
scheme.name: ISIN (International Securities Identifying Number)
scheme.note: Body owning this CV: Not a single body, by the specifications of the ISIN the NSINs (National Securities Identifying Number) is assigned by a local national body for each country.
Body owning the format of the ISIN codes: ISO - International Organization for Standardization - www.iso.org

scheme.definition: This International Standard specifies the structure for a three-letter alphabetic code and an equivalent three-digit numeric code for the representation of currencies and funds. For those currencies having minor units, it also shows the decimal relationship between such units and the currency itself.
scheme.name: ISO Market Identifer Codes (MIC) - ISO 10383
scheme.note: Body owning this CV: ISO - International Organization for Standardization - www.iso.org

scheme.definition: Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions -- Part 1: Country codes. The short country names from ISO 3166-1 and the alpha-2 codes are made available by ISO at no charge for internal use and non-commercial purposes.
scheme.name: ISO 2-letter country name codes - ISO 3166-1 alpha-2
scheme.note: Body owning this CV: ISO - International Organization for Standardization - www.iso.org

scheme.definition: Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions -- Part 1: Country codes. The short country names from ISO 3166-1 and the alpha-2 codes are made available by ISO at no charge for internal use and non-commercial purposes.
scheme.name: ISO 3-letter country name codes - ISO 3166-1 alpha-3
scheme.note: Body owning this CV: ISO - International Organization for Standardization - www.iso.org

scheme.definition: This International Standard specifies the structure for a three-letter alphabetic code and an equivalent three-digit numeric code for the representation of currencies and funds. For those currencies having minor units, it also shows the decimal relationship between such units and the currency itself.
scheme.name: ISO currency codes - ISO 4217 - alpha codes
scheme.note: Body owning this CV: ISO - International Organization for Standardization - www.iso.org

scheme.definition: This International Standard specifies the structure for a three-letter alphabetic code and an equivalent three-digit numeric code for the representation of currencies and funds. For those currencies having minor units, it also shows the decimal relationship between such units and the currency itself.
scheme.name: ISO currency codes - ISO 4217 - numeric codes
scheme.note: Body owning this CV: ISO - International Organization for Standardization - www.iso.org

scheme.definition: Classification of sports is individually governed by each International Federation in the Paralympic Movement, within the framework of the IPC Classification Code. Based on that for each sport one to many classes may be defined.
scheme.name: Paralympic sports
scheme.note: Body owning this CV: International Paralympic Committee (IPC) - www.paralympic.org

scheme.definition: The SEC Submission Type defines the specific submission type, and implied form specification, associated with filing a document to the U.S. SEC EDGAR database.
scheme.name: SEC Submission Type
scheme.note: Body owning this CV: U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission - www.sec.gov
Body owning the format of the codes: U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission - www.sec.gov

scheme.definition: A SEDOL is a Country-level Identifier issued across all asset classes in all jurisdictions globally.
scheme.name: Stock Exchange Daily Official List
scheme.note: Body owning this CV: The London Stock Exchange - www.londonstockexchange.com

scheme.definition: A set of alphanumeric characters allocated by a trading venue to a listed security.
scheme.name: Ticker
scheme.note: Body owning this CV: not applicable

Users should not assume that a ticker symbol will uniquely identify an organisation. For example some ticker symbols identify stock indexes, or A- and B-class shares of a company, or listings on multiple exchanges.

scheme.definition: A TIDM identifies a security listed on the London Stock Exchange.
scheme.name: Tradable Instrument Display Mnemonics
scheme.note: Body owning this CV: The London Stock Exchange - www.londonstockexchange.com

scheme.definition: Entities, categories or other resources from DBpedia. DBpedia is a crowd-sourced community effort to extract structured information from Wikipedia and make this information available on the Web. Find more at http://dbpedia.org
scheme.name: DBpedia resource

scheme.definition: A community-maintained music encyclopedia that collects music metadata and makes it available to the public. Find more details about this vocabulary at https://musicbrainz.org/doc/Artist
scheme.name: Musicbrainz artist resource

scheme.definition: A community-maintained music encyclopedia that collects music metadata and makes it available to the public. Find more details about this vocabulary at https://musicbrainz.org/doc/Label
scheme.name: Musicbrainz label resource

scheme.definition: A community-maintained music encyclopedia that collects music metadata and makes it available to the public. Find more details about this vocabulary at https://musicbrainz.org/doc/Recording
scheme.name: Musicbrainz recording resource

scheme.definition: A community-maintained music encyclopedia that collects music metadata and makes it available to the public. Find more details about this vocabulary at https://musicbrainz.org/doc/Release
scheme.name: Musicbrainz release resource

scheme.definition: A community-maintained music encyclopedia that collects music metadata and makes it available to the public. Find more details about this vocabulary at https://musicbrainz.org/doc/Release_Group
scheme.name: Musicbrainz release-group resource

scheme.definition: A community-maintained music encyclopedia that collects music metadata and makes it available to the public. Find more details about this vocabulary at https://musicbrainz.org/doc/Work
scheme.name: Musicbrainz work resource

scheme.definition: A crowd-sourced geographical database which covers all countries and contains over eight million placenames that are available free of charge.
scheme.name: Geonames resource

scheme.definition: Entities, categories or other resources from Freebase. Freebase is an open, Creative Commons Attribution (aka CC-BY) licensed collection of structured data.
scheme.name: Freebase resource
W3C SKOS namespace
scheme.note: Body owning this vocabulary: W3C - www.w3.org

scheme.definition: Wikidata is a free database acting as central storage for structured data about Wikipedia and other Wikimedia sister projects like Wikivoyage, Wikisource, and others.
scheme.name: Wikidata/Wikipedia resource
